data.title: MERN Starter Recipe should include a note to add nodemon to PATH
data.body:
Testing #27463

After creating the launch.json as instructed, pressing F5 gives  an error "Cannot find runtime 'nodemon' on PATH" shows up

Since nodemon is needed in the PATH, a note about the same should be added to the recipe

data.title: New emmet suggestions dont show up in an untitled file with HTML type
data.body:
#27316

- Open a new untitled file
- Set the file type to HTML
- Add `<html></html>`
- Type `div` in the middle and press `tab`. A tab is inserted.

I think it should do an emmet expansion?

data.title: Hard wrap

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Please add automatic "hard wrap" functionality in VScode. Identical to what is available in vim: http://vim.wikia.com/wiki/Automatic_word_wrapping.
It may be off by default but may be switched on if a textwidth variable is specified.

It would be of great help for Latex documents for example.

data.title: Add some tests for terminal path DND parsing
data.body:
See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27511 and https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/0913cd5b89de025df59b8d34153157c6fa5cc9ae

Test something like this:

```
\foo bar"'? ;'??  :
```

```
\\foo\ bar\"\'\?\ \;\'\?\?\ \ \:
```

data.title: MacOS crashes when using <COMMAND>+Q with --wait option

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0-insiders
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open an editor with `code-insiders -w foo.txt`
2. In the editor that pops up, press `COMMAND + Q`

The windows will all close, but there will be two stale processes in the Activity Monitor, I'm unable to get another editor window open until I kill the background processes.

Would expect that `COMMAND + Q` in a waited window to close the window only, not all windows, and wouldn't expect to be unable to open a new window...

----

Alternative:  If it's a `--wait` window, close when the last editor window is closed `COMMAND + W`

data.title: merge the code-insiders to code command
data.body:
Sometimes is confused to call vs code on cmd or other  command app. I discovered by accident that on VS Code Insiders I should type code-insider instead of code (that is incredibly simple!)

My suggestion is consolidate into a single command.

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 (ver-1607 - 14393,1198)

Steps to Reproduce:
on cmd go any directory 
1. cd c:\ test
2. then type code .
then returns this error message:

> code-insiders : The term 'code' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable
program. Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.

data.title: Arrow down in a wrapped line gets read in its entirety by NVDA
data.body:
Extracted from @Neurrone 's comment in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/26730#issuecomment-303906193

I've installed the add-on and the global plugin that bumps the wait time up to 200ms.

A possibly related problem: if a long line of text is wrapped across multiple lines, NVDA incorrectly reads the entire line when arrowing through. For example, this section is right at the top of the default settings.json file 

```
// Controls auto save of dirty files. Accepted values:  'off', 'afterDelay', 'onFocusChange' (editor loses focus), 'onWindowChange' (window loses focus). If set to 'afterDelay', you can configure the delay in 'files.autoSaveDelay'.
  ```

NVDA reads the entire 3-line block when arrowing through each line.

data.title: Up arrow in a read only editor sometimes moves you outside the editor
data.body:
Extracted from @Neurrone 's comment in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/26730#issuecomment-303906193

I've installed the add-on and the global plugin that bumps the wait time up to 200ms.

...

Also when in the editor for files in readonly mode, pressing up arrow when on the first line unexpectedly moves you outside the editor. Down arrows will also sometimes move you outside the editor as well.

data.title: Allow custom icons for reference/IntelliSense components
Emmet: Select prev item gets stuck in comment blocks
data.body:
Testing #27316

- Create a HTML file with multiple tags
- Comment one of the tags
- Keep cursor anywhere after the commented tag.
- Use `Emmet: Select prev Item` to navigate through the tags and attributes

Observe that once you reach the commented tag, select prev doesnt work anymore.

Ideally we should skip commented tags.
Note: In css files, the commented parts do get skipped

data.title: typescript.npm doesn't work on Linux
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (3a6eda74ead5b5b041da0bbc18b70218e8c95bba, 2017-05-31T05:11:41.588Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-21-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.3.0|
|theme-sapphire|Tyriar|0.2.1|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.2|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.3.2|
|md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.2|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|;


---

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27695

Steps to Reproduce:

Note that I installed nodejs via a package manager originally.

1.

  ```
  sudo mv /usr/bin/npm /usr/bin/npm2
  rm -rf ~/.cache/typescript
  ```

2. Verify that I get the error when attempting to fetch jquery types.
3. Close vscode.
4. Download nodejs and place in `/home/daniel/tools/node-v6.10.3-linux-x64`.
5. Launch VS Code
6. Set `"typescript.npm": "/home/daniel/tools/node-v6.10.3-linux-x64/bin/npm"`
7. Try get jquery ATA working, no error occurs but no types appear

  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/26645029/926ef472-45eb-11e7-9073-4ecba96b4324.png)

8. Check cache

```
$ ls ~/.cache/typescript/
package.json
$ cat ~/.cache/typescript/package.json
{}
```

data.title: ATA is Automatic Type Acquisition
data.body: Updating setting comments.

data.title: Align explorer sorting with platform sorting
data.body:
It looks like our file sorting in the explorer does not match platform beahviour in some cases.

**Windows:**
* a file `foo.ts` is sorted before `foo_test.ts` but we sort it the other way around

**Linux:**
* a file `foo.ts` is sorted before `foo_test.ts` but we sort it the other way around
* a lowercase file seems to be sorted before an upper case file but we seem to mix the sorting independent of the casing (e.g. folders `[out, outb, outd, Outa, Outc]` are showing up as `[out, OutA, outb, Outc, outd]`

**macOS:**
* seems to be OK

We use a JavaScript [`Collator`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Collator) for the comparing [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/common/comparers.ts#L19). 

Unfortunately I am not able to tweak the Collator options to bring me the desired result...

data.title: The Python auto-indent does not align functional input over multiple lines

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

The Python auto-indent does not align function input within brackets.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Insert the code: `print('when I press enter in a function with long inputs ' 'the next line goes to the beginning')`
2. Position the cursor between the two strings, i.e. `...inputs' |'the...`
3. Press enter
This is the result:
```
print('when I press enter in a function with long inputs ' 
'the next line goes to the beginning')
```
This is the expected result:
```
print('when I press enter in a function with long inputs ' 
      'I expect the next line to be indented')
```

data.title: Consistent name for overviewRuler.currentContentForeground
data.body:
For consistency, rename 
- overviewRuler.currentContentForeground -> editorOverviewRuler.currentContentForeground
- overviewRuler.incomingContentForeground -> editorOverviewRuler.incomingContentForeground

data.title: Add option to enable Proposed API with settings
data.body:
Right now Proposed APIs are enabled if 
1. Someone is debugging VSCode extension
OR
2. Passed command line switch when starting VSCode from command line.

I think it would be cool if people could enable Proposed APIs by just using settings (turned off by default)

data.title: Surpress warnings from other extensions
data.body: When doing extension development we warn about invalid use of our contribution points. However, that isn't limited to the extension you're just developing but to all extensions you have installed. This is a source of spam and we should show warnings only for extensions you author.

data.title: Inactive tab titles on inactive editor pane are unreadable when two editor panes are open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: MS Windows 7 Enterprise, 6.1.7601 SP1 Build 7601

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open four files such that there are two editor panes and two tabs in each editor pane
2.  Get focus on one editor pane
3.  The inactive tab titles in the inactive editor pane are nearly unreadable in most provided themes, especially dark ones (Abyss, Dark, Dark+, Kimbie Dark, etc). The light themes still have this problem, but to a lesser extent. The only theme that doesn't have this problem is "High Contrast".

This seems to have been introduced in version 1.12.*

All the following images have the right editor pane active:
Abyss:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20233128/26637354/451cb4a0-45ed-11e7-9faf-c1f3e3a6a710.png)

Dark:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20233128/26637397/6118f88a-45ed-11e7-9997-533441d5fe74.png)

Dark+:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20233128/26637433/79a1d26e-45ed-11e7-95c2-50b9fcf7569d.png)

data.title: "ctrl+/" matches "ctrl+o" in the Keybindings Editor UI
data.body:
* On Windows
* write the following keybinding to the `keybindings.json`: `{ "key": "ctrl+[slash]", "command": "actions.find"}`
* in the Keybindings Editor UI
* search for `"ctrl+/"`
* unexpectedly, `ctrl+o` is matched:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/26635715/f2173e00-461a-11e7-95f0-1ce189cddbee.png)

data.title: [php] Syntax highlighting breaks when using <script> injection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- VSCode Insiders Version: 1.14.0 (fda3ed38449fea27b97698ad0950c2870bf6afaa, 2017-06-14T05:13:12.994Z)
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64
- Color Theme: Monokai

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any .php file
2. Insert <script><?php ?></script> anywhere

This is about an old issue: #15792
Still happening for me. (I've tried disabling all extensions too)
Also, if you try to insert HTML inside of a PHP's curly braces, the HTML syntax highlighting breaks too.

**Example**:
```
<?php
    echo $test;
    // syntax highlighting ok
?>
<script>
    <?php echo $test; ?>
</script>
<?php
    echo $test;
    // syntax highlighting broken
?>
    <input></input>
     <!-- HTML syntax highlighting ok -->
<?php if(true) { ?>
    <input id="test"></input>
    <!-- HTML syntax highlighting broken -->
<?php } ?>
```

Removing <script></script> will also fix this HTML syntax highlighting.

data.title: Clearly document that the value 'undefined' is passed to TreeDataProvider.getChildren to indicate the "Root"
data.body:
Testing #27467:

Clearly document that the value 'undefined' is passed to TreeDataProvider.getChildren to indicate the "Root".
The doc says only: "The element from which the provider gets children for."

data.title: Titlebar remains blue when window looses focus
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|code-gnu-global|austin|0.2.2|
|gitignore|codezombiech|0.5.0|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.61|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.2|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.15|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change Windows theme to Classic theme (Windows 95 lookalike)
2. Launch Code. Notice window title bar is blue
3. Move focus to another window (e.g. start Notepad)
4. Notive how Code window titlebar is still blue.

I also have Docker Toolbox installed and a Bash terminal running.

data.title: TreeDataProvider.getChildren is called on extension activation
data.body:
Testing #27467:

In the extension's activation I register the TreeDataProvider like this:
```js
vscode.window.registerTreeDataProviderForView('loadedScriptsExplorer', new ScriptsExplorer());
```

When the extension gets activated, `TreeDataProvider.getChildren` is called even if the tree section "Loaded Scripts" in the Navigator is still collapsed:
![2017-05-31_15-51-37](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/26635152/195df4ec-4619-11e7-9e3f-2fb503397215.png)

I would expect that `TreeDataProvider.getChildren` is called when I expand the "Loaded Scripts" section in the navigator.
